title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 26 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 26.

questions.question: Who was Meshelemiah's father according to 1 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:1 states that Meshelemiah was the son of Kore.

questions.question: How many sons did Meshelemiah have?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:3 lists seven sons of Meshelemiah.

questions.question: Who was the firstborn son of Obededom?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:4 mentions Shemaiah as the firstborn son of Obededom.

questions.question: True or False: The sons of Obededom were known for being mighty men of valor.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:6 states that the sons of Shemaiah, son of Obededom, were mighty men of valor.

questions.question: How many strong men did Meshelemiah have, including his sons and brethren?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:9 says Meshelemiah had eighteen strong men including sons and brethren.

questions.question: Who was made chief among Hosah's sons, despite not being the firstborn?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:10 notes that Simri was made chief by his father though not the firstborn.

questions.question: How many sons and brethren did Hosah have?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:11 states that Hosah's sons and brethren totaled thirteen.

questions.question: True or False: The divisions of the porters ministered in the house of the LORD by casting lots for their gates.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:12-13 explains that lots were cast for each gate among the porters to minister in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: Which direction was assigned to Shelemiah by the lot?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:14 states the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah.

questions.question: Who was given the lot for the northward gate?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:14 says Zechariah, son of Shelemiah, was assigned the northward lot.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'At Parbar westward, ___ at the causeway, and two at Parbar.'
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:18 states that four were at the causeway and two at Parbar westward.

questions.question: Who was over the treasures of the house of God according to this chapter?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:20 says Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God.

questions.question: True or False: Shebuel, son of Gershom, was ruler of the treasures.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:24 confirms Shebuel was the ruler of the treasures.

questions.question: Who was over the outward business for Israel, including officers and judges?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:29 records Chenaniah and his sons as over the outward business of Israel.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 26:31-32, who did King David make rulers over the Reubenites, Gadites, and half tribe of Manasseh?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:31-32 shows Jerijah and his brethren were made rulers over those tribes by King David.

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 26 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to trust God in their leadership role at church. Based on the divisions of porters in 1 Chronicles 26, what biblical truth would you share about faith and obedience?
options: God blesses those who faithfully serve in their appointed duties.
Leadership roles are given only to the strongest physically.
Only firstborn sons should lead in the church.
Division of labor is irrelevant in God’s house.
questions.correctAnswer: God blesses those who faithfully serve in their appointed duties.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:5 shows that God blessed Obededom and his family for their faithful service. Also, verses 6-8 emphasize the strength and valor of those who served faithfully, teaching us that faithfulness and obedience in our roles bring God's blessing.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 26 teach us about humility and contentment in serving others, particularly regarding the appointment of chiefs?
options: A father may appoint a capable son as chief regardless of birth order.
Only the firstborn should be appointed to leadership.
Leadership is based on popularity among the people.
Chiefs are appointed by casting lots alone.
questions.correctAnswer: A father may appoint a capable son as chief regardless of birth order.
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 26:10, though Simri was not the firstborn, his father Hosah made him the chief, teaching us that God values ability and character over birthright, encouraging humility and contentment with God’s sovereign appointments.

questions.question: A church member is discouraged because their role is not as prominent as others. Based on 1 Chronicles 26, what encouragement about service and stewardship would you give?
options: Every role, big or small, has a purpose in God’s house.
Only the most visible roles are important to God.
Service is only valuable if it leads to leadership.
God favors those who seek the highest positions.
questions.correctAnswer: Every role, big or small, has a purpose in God’s house.
questions.explanation: Verses 12-19 describe the divisions of porters and their assigned gates, showing that each person’s service was essential for the ministry of the house of the LORD, teaching us to be content and faithful in whatever role God gives.

questions.question: How does the casting of lots for gate duties in 1 Chronicles 26 illustrate integrity and fairness in church service?
options: Casting lots ensured impartial and fair assignment of duties.
Leaders assigned duties based on favoritism.
Only the strongest received the best positions.
Duties were assigned by seniority alone.
questions.correctAnswer: Casting lots ensured impartial and fair assignment of duties.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:13-16 explains that lots were cast for the gates, showing a system that avoided partiality, teaching us to maintain integrity and fairness in church leadership and service.

questions.question: A believer wants to practice good stewardship with church resources. What can they learn from 1 Chronicles 26 about managing dedicated treasures?
options: Stewardship of dedicated things requires trustworthy leadership.
Treasures should be used without accountability.
Only kings can manage church treasures.
Stewardship is not important in spiritual service.
questions.correctAnswer: Stewardship of dedicated things requires trustworthy leadership.
questions.explanation: Verses 20-28 describe leaders such as Ahijah and Shelomith who were over the treasures and dedicated things, highlighting the importance of responsibility and integrity in managing God’s resources.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 26 encourage perseverance through trials in serving God’s house?
options: Mighty men of valour and their families served faithfully over many years.
Only perfect people can serve God’s house.
Service is only temporary and unimportant.
Faithfulness is rewarded quickly and visibly.
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty men of valour and their families served faithfully over many years.
questions.explanation: Verses 7-8 and 31-32 describe families and leaders who served faithfully and were recognized as men of valour, teaching perseverance and faithfulness despite challenges.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with jealousy over others’ roles in the church. What biblical wisdom from 1 Chronicles 26 would help them?
options: God assigns roles wisely, and each role is important for His work.
Only the most visible roles matter to God.
Jealousy is justified in spiritual service.
Roles are assigned based on human preference.
questions.correctAnswer: God assigns roles wisely, and each role is important for His work.
questions.explanation: The detailed divisions and assignments in verses 12-19 show God’s wise organization, teaching us to trust His plan and find contentment in our assigned service.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 26, the sons of Obededom were blessed by God because of their service.
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states that God blessed Obededom and his family, showing that faithful service leads to God’s blessing.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Chronicles 26 teaches that leadership positions in the house of the LORD were given strictly according to birth order.
questions.explanation: Verse 10 shows that although Simri was not the firstborn, his father made him chief, indicating that leadership was given based on capability rather than birth order.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 26 demonstrate the importance of integrity in church administration?
options: Leaders faithfully managed treasures dedicated by kings and leaders.
Church treasures were managed without oversight.
Anyone could take from the dedicated treasures.
The treasures were unimportant to God’s work.
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders faithfully managed treasures dedicated by kings and leaders.
questions.explanation: Verses 26-28 explain that Shelomith and his brethren were responsible for all the dedicated things, emphasizing trustworthy stewardship and integrity in church administration.

questions.question: A believer feels called to serve but lacks a prominent position. Based on 1 Chronicles 26, what biblical principle about serving in God’s house would you share?
options: Every servant’s role is vital for the ministry of the LORD.
Only leaders matter in church service.
questions.correctAnswer: Every servant’s role is vital for the ministry of the LORD.
questions.explanation: The organization of porters in verses 12-19 shows that every gate and role was necessary, teaching us to serve faithfully regardless of prominence.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 26 teach us about family legacy and spiritual discipline in serving God?
options: Families faithfully served together across generations as mighty men of valour.
Only individuals serve, family involvement is discouraged.
Spiritual service is unrelated to family heritage.
Families were divided and not involved in service.
questions.correctAnswer: Families faithfully served together across generations as mighty men of valour.
questions.explanation: Verses 6-8 and 31-32 show how sons and brethren served together with strength, emphasizing spiritual discipline and legacy within families.

questions.question: A believer is learning about church order and asks how God’s house was organized in David’s time. What does 1 Chronicles 26 teach regarding this?
options: There were specific divisions and gates with assigned porters and Levites.
There was no organization in God’s house.
All duties were performed by one group.
questions.correctAnswer: There were specific divisions and gates with assigned porters and Levites.
questions.explanation: The chapter details the divisions of porters, their gates, and their assignments (verses 12-19), illustrating orderly service and discipline in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 1 Chronicles 26:20-22, Ahijah and Jehieli were over the __________ of the house of God.
questions.explanation: Verses 20-22 state that Ahijah and Jehieli were over the treasures of the house of God, highlighting the importance of faithful stewardship.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 26 instruct us about generosity and dedicating spoils or resources to God’s work?
options: Spoils won in battles were dedicated to maintain the house of the LORD.
Resources should be kept for personal use only.
Dedicating resources is optional and unimportant.
Only kings can dedicate spoils to God.
questions.correctAnswer: Spoils won in battles were dedicated to maintain the house of the LORD.
questions.explanation: Verse 27 explains that spoils won in battle were dedicated for the LORD's house, teaching generosity and stewardship in supporting God’s work.

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 26.

questions.question: Which family is mentioned as having divisions of porters in 1 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:1 states, 'Concerning the divisions of the porters: Of the Korhites was Meshelemiah the son of Kore...,' identifying the Korhites as the family responsible.

questions.question: What method was used to assign the porter duties at the gates according to 1 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: Verse 13 says, 'And they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to the house of their fathers, for every gate,' indicating that casting lots was the method.

questions.question: Who was given the lot eastward for the porter division?
questions.explanation: Verse 14 clearly states, 'And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah,' assigning him the eastward gate.

questions.question: The sons of Obededom were known for what characteristic according to 1 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: Verse 6 notes, '...for they were mighty men of valour,' describing the sons of Obededom as strong and capable.

questions.question: Who was over the treasures of the house of God as mentioned in this chapter?
questions.explanation: Verse 20 says, 'And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God,' assigning him this responsibility.

questions.question: Which descendant of Moses was ruler of the treasures?
questions.explanation: Verse 24 identifies 'Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures,' linking Moses’ lineage to this role.

questions.question: The term 'house of Asuppim' in verse 15 likely refers to what?
questions.explanation: The 'Asuppim' is often understood as a guardhouse or storehouse area related to temple service, consistent with porter duties in verses 15 and 17.

questions.question: In the context of ancient Near Eastern temple service, what does the distribution of gates and wards in this chapter illustrate?
questions.explanation: Verses 12-18 describe gate assignments to Levites and porters, showing a structure for guarding and orderly ministering at the temple.

questions.question: Who was appointed chief among the sons of Merari despite not being the firstborn?
questions.explanation: Verse 10 states, 'Simri the chief, (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the chief;),' highlighting the custom of appointing leaders beyond primogeniture.

questions.question: What is the significance of casting lots for both small and great as mentioned in the chapter?
questions.explanation: Casting lots in ancient Israel was a means to discern God's will impartially, as noted in verse 13 where all, regardless of status, participated.

questions.question: Shelomith and his brethren were responsible for what according to 1 Chronicles 26?
options: All the treasures of the dedicated things
questions.correctAnswer: All the treasures of the dedicated things
questions.explanation: Verses 25-26 explain that Shelomith and his brothers were over all treasures dedicated by King David and others for the LORD’s house.

questions.question: How many men of valour were made rulers over the Reubenites, Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh?
questions.explanation: Verse 32 states, '...men of valour, were two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom king David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh,' indicating this number.

questions.question: True or False: The sons of Laadan were responsible for the outward business over Israel, including officers and judges.
questions.explanation: Verse 29 states it was the Izharites, specifically Chenaniah and his sons, who were responsible for outward business and judging, not the sons of Laadan.

questions.question: What does the presence of many named individuals with specific roles in this chapter indicate about the chronicler's intent?
options: To establish genealogical and administrative legitimacy
questions.correctAnswer: To establish genealogical and administrative legitimacy
questions.explanation: The chronicler meticulously lists names and roles (e.g., verses 1-7, 21-26) to affirm the legitimacy and order of temple service and governance under David's reign.

questions.question: Which gate direction had the fewest Levites assigned, and how many were assigned there?
questions.explanation: Verses 17-18 detail the assignments, stating 'At Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar,' indicating the least were two at Parbar.

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 26 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Which family was responsible for the divisions of the porters in 1 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:1 identifies the Korhites as the family responsible for the divisions of the porters. This highlights God's organized approach for service, consistent with the Levites' roles in temple duties (Numbers 3:27-32; 1 Chronicles 9:17; Ezra 2:42; Nehemiah 7:43).

questions.question: Who was the firstborn son of Meshelemiah, according to 1 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:2 states Zechariah as the firstborn son of Meshelemiah. This reflects the biblical pattern of naming firstborn sons, who often had leadership roles (Genesis 25:33; Exodus 13:2; Deuteronomy 21:17; Hebrews 12:23).

questions.question: What is noted about the sons of Obededom in this chapter?
options: They were mighty men of valour
questions.correctAnswer: They were mighty men of valour
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:6-7 describes the sons of Obededom as mighty men of valour who ruled throughout their father's house. This illustrates God's provision of strength and leadership among His servants (Psalm 78:72; 2 Samuel 23:8-39; Nehemiah 7:7; 2 Chronicles 17:7-9).

questions.question: How many strong men were there among the sons and brethren of Obededom?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:8 states that the sons and brethren of Obededom were sixty-two able men for strength for the service. This reflects the order and strength God requires for temple service (1 Chronicles 15:18; 2 Chronicles 31:14; Exodus 38:21; Numbers 4:47).

questions.question: Who was made chief among Hosah's sons despite not being the firstborn?
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 26:10, Simri was made chief by his father Hosah, though he was not the firstborn. This reflects the biblical principle that God's calling and leadership are not always by birth order (1 Samuel 16:7; Judges 6:15; Genesis 49:3-4; Romans 9:11).

questions.question: How were the divisions of the porters assigned to their respective gates?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:13 shows that the porter divisions were assigned by casting lots. This method demonstrates God's sovereign guidance in decisions (Proverbs 16:33; Acts 1:26; Joshua 18:10; Leviticus 16:8).

questions.question: Which direction was assigned to Shelemiah by lot?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:14 states the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. This reflects the ordered structure for temple service, symbolizing God's presence from the east (Ezekiel 43:1-4; Matthew 24:27; Revelation 7:2; Psalm 48:2).

questions.question: Who was over the treasures of the house of God according to this chapter?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:20 states that Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God. This stewardship of sacred valuables aligns with biblical principles of faithful management (Matthew 25:14-30; 1 Corinthians 4:2; Luke 16:10; Nehemiah 13:13).

questions.question: Which descendant of Moses was ruler of the treasures in 1 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:24 identifies Shebuel, son of Gershom and grandson of Moses, as ruler of the treasures. This shows the continuity of priestly and Levitical duties within Moses' lineage (Exodus 32:25-29; Numbers 3:17-19; Deuteronomy 18:5; Hebrews 7:14).

questions.question: What was the source of the dedicated treasures maintained by Shelomith and his brethren?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:27 explains that spoils won in battles were dedicated to maintain the house of the LORD. This reflects how God's people consecrate victory gifts to Him (Numbers 31:25-47; Joshua 6:19; 1 Samuel 30:24; 2 Samuel 8:1).

questions.question: Who were responsible for the outward business over Israel, including officers and judges?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:29 states Chenaniah and his sons of the Izharites managed outward business over Israel as officers and judges. This highlights God's provision of governance and justice within His people (Exodus 18:21; Deuteronomy 16:18; Acts 6:3; Romans 13:1-4).

questions.question: How many men of valour were officers among the Hebronites west of Jordan?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:30 records 1,700 men of valour among the Hebronites as officers west of Jordan. This demonstrates God's empowerment of leaders for His kingdom's service (Judges 6:12; 2 Samuel 23:8-39; Nehemiah 11:24; Hebrews 11:32).

questions.question: In the fortieth year of King David’s reign, where were mighty men of valour found among the Hebronites?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:31 mentions mighty men of valour among the Hebronites at Jazer of Gilead. This reflects God's ongoing provision of warriors to secure His people and His purposes (Joshua 12:7; Judges 11:1; 2 Samuel 2:12; Psalm 144:1).

questions.question: Who did King David appoint as rulers over the Reubenites, Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 26:32 states that Jerijah and his brethren were made rulers over these tribes for matters pertaining to God and the king. This shows God's order in governance and the integration of spiritual and civil authority (Exodus 18:21-22; 1 Chronicles 27:18; Deuteronomy 1:13; Romans 13:1).

questions.question: What theological principle about God’s governance is illustrated by the casting of lots for temple duties?
questions.explanation: Casting lots (1 Chronicles 26:13) reveals God's sovereign supervision over even the smallest decisions in His service, consistent with other biblical examples (Proverbs 16:33; Acts 1:26; Joshua 18:10; Leviticus 16:8). It teaches that God directs His people’s work.
